questions.question:
Daniel and Sofia each think of a different whole number greater than 0 and less than 100.
Daniel’s number is a multiple of 4.
Sofia’s number is an odd number which is a multiple of 9.
What is the difference between the largest possible value of Daniel’s number and the smallest possible value of Sofia’s number?

Priya multiplies the smallest three-digit whole number by the largest two-digit whole number.
What is the answer?

David bought 5 pizzas to share with Emma, Tom, and Sarah.
Emma ate 5/7 of a pizza.
Tom ate 9/7 of a pizza.
Sarah ate 4/7 of a pizza.
David ate all the remaining pizza.
How much more pizza did David eat than Emma?

Rectangles X and Y both have the same area.

What is the width of rectangle Y?

Jake has a cup containing 200 mL of juice, and a jug containing 1200 mL of water.
Jake drinks 20 mL of the juice.
He finds the drink too sweet, so he adds water from the jug until the total liquid reaches 400 mL.

How much water is left in the jug?
The symbol always represents the same number and the symbol represents another number.

Maria had $20. She gave some of this money to Juan.
Maria then gave half of what she had left to Leo.
Leo gave half of what he was given to Mia.
Mia received $2.50.
How much did Maria give to Juan?

145 candies are shared among 16 children. Each child gets 9 candies and 1 candy is left.
Which number sentence shows this information?

A large rectangle has sides 12 cm and 14 cm.
Two small rectangles are removed from this large rectangle.
This leaves the shaded shape.

What is the perimeter of the shaded shape?

Ethan, Lily, and Noah shared a chocolate cake.

Ethan ate 1/3 of the cake, Lily ate 1/4 of the cake, and Noah ate the rest.
Which of the following statements are correct?
Statement 1: Noah ate less than half of the cake.
Statement 2: Ethan ate less than one-quarter of the cake.
Statement 3: Ethan and Lily together ate less than two-thirds of the cake.

In a magic square, each row, column, and diagonal add up to the same total.

If ▲ = 21, what is the missing number at ❤?

Oliver and Maya both round the number 3,480,000.
Oliver rounds it to the nearest million.
Maya rounds it to the nearest hundred thousand.
What is the difference between their answers?

Three different bags are weighed in pairs.
Different pairs of bags have combined weights of 18 kg, 22 kg, and 28 kg as shown.

When the three bags are weighed together, what is their combined weight?
In the number 34,060, how many times larger is the value represented by digit 3 than the value represented by the digit 6?

A shop sells apples, bananas, and oranges.
The number of oranges is triple the number of apples.
The number of bananas is half the number of oranges.
If there are 20 apples, how many bananas are there?

A rectangle has a perimeter of 64 cm.
If its length is thrice its width, what is the width?
What is the area of the pink part?

A 5-liter water tank is filled in three stages:
First, 30% is filled.
Then, 40% of the remaining water is added.
Finally, the rest is filled.
How many liters were added in the final stage?

A farm has cows, chickens, and goats.
½ of the animals are cows.
¼ are chickens.
The rest are goats.
If there are 120 animals in total, how many goats are there?

A 1.8 meter stick is cut into three parts.
The lengths are in the ratio 2:3:4.
What is the length of the longest piece?

A gym charges membership fees:
$20 per month
A one-time registration fee of $30
How much will a member pay in 8 months?

Liam divides a garden fence into equal sections.
He paints some sections blue, as shown in the figure.
He then paints 1/3 of the whole fence red.
Finally, he paints the rest of the fence brown.

How many sections does he paint brown?
What is the size of the reflex angle given below?

Zara finds a set of decimal number cards and wants to arrange them in ascending order. Here are the cards she has:

After carefully sorting them, Zara selects the middle card in the sequence.
Which number does she find in the middle?

Kiran draws two identical right-angled isosceles triangles on the pavement to form a parallelogram.
She labels the four corners A, B, C, and D, as shown in the diagram.

Kiran starts at point A and walks along the edges of the parallelogram in order: A → B → C → D
Which sequence of compass directions does she follow?

E, then NE, then W, then SW
W, then SE, then E, then NW
E, then NW, then W, then SE

questions.question: When an odd number is divided by 6, what are all of the possible remainders?

In a fruit market, there are three ways to buy apples, as shown:

1 apple for $0.40
Bag of 8 apples for $3.00
Bag of 25 apples for $9.00
Sophia has $20. What is the maximum number of apples she can buy?

Emma, Liam, and Noah are cycling around a circular track. They all start at the same point and begin cycling at the same time.

Emma completes one lap every 6 minutes. Liam completes one lap every 9 minutes. Noah completes one lap every 15 minutes. After how many minutes will all three cyclists be back at the starting point at the same time?

A gardener plants flowers in a rectangular and triangular section of a garden.
The rectangular section has a length 3 times its width.
The total area of this rectangle is 108 m².
Next to the rectangle, there is a triangular flowerbed with a base equal to the width of the rectangle and a height of 4 m.

What is the total area of the garden?

Emma buys pens and notebooks.
A pen costs $1.50
A notebook costs $3.80
She buys 5 pens and 3 notebooks
What is the total cost?

A farmer has chickens and cows.
The total number of animals is 48.
The total number of legs is 140.
How many cows are there?

At 2:00 PM, the angle, measured clockwise, from the minute hand to the hour hand is 60°.

What will the angle, measured clockwise, from the hour hand to the minute hand be at 2:20 PM?

A rope is cut into three pieces.
The longest piece is twice the shortest.
The middle piece is 10 cm longer than the shortest.
The total length is 90 cm.
What is the length of the shortest piece?
Determine the measure of the angle x.
Which of the following polygons cannot be cut into two trapeziums using one straight line?
